description:
I really liked this place! Looks nice and presentable inside, great customer service and food was very good! Ordered the green curry and red curry by the way.

 Will definitely come back!
author: Anna B.

description:
Was in the neighborhood today and was craving more Thai food after yesterday's fantastic lunch at a super duper authentic Thai place in SF . Won't reveal the name here but hint: it's on Florida St in the Mission. 

Decided to give Lana Thai a try since I got parking right in front.   Ordered their lunch combo special -pad Thai, curry chicken, and rice. At $6.95 it seams like a deal.   So disappointed that it's all carbs- a scoop of rice, pad Thai ( just the noodles with some mediocre flavor and a couple of lonely bean sprouts, a few morsels of eggs. 

The chicken curry part was about 5 or 6 tablespoons , consisting mostly of curry sauce, 2 baby carrots, 2 bits of potatoes. and 2 teeny bits of chicken not even the size of a chicken McNugget.  Where's the chicken??  

Lesson learned : you get what you pay for.  If you want friendly service, no wait, carbs to fill the tummy, this is your place.  Any other expectation, look elsewhere. 

Giving it 2 stars cuz the owners are very nice, but food wise, nah.  Sorry - won't be back . 
.
author: mimi l.

description:
This place is cheap, it offers some low-carb, high-protein options if you are trying to eat out on a diet but...my god it's so hard to visit because the hours are so limited. The owners are quite nice and the food is A-OK to me. I would probably come back if their hours fit my schedule better.

If I remember correctly their hours are unusual for a restaurant for example opening at 12:00 instead of 11:00 for lunch or closing at 20:00 instead of 21:00 like most places. I think I tried to come here 3 times before finally finding the right time.
author: Daniel C.

description: I've been enjoying the food and service from Paul and his family for just about thirty years - yikes! Try this fantastic Thai cuisine restaurant - you will be happy.
author: Mark M.

description:
First off, this place is great. I was just looking for some cheap Thai food and this place is it! We had a complete dinner and a papaya salad to share. It was enough food for the two of us and I think our check was less than $20. 

The server was super nice and very attentive. The place isn't a hole in the wall, but it's not crazy fancy either. It's a bit cold inside, but they do have a small heater in the corner. I think the restaurant is ran by an older couple. Overall, most definitely would go back.
author: Julie L.

description:
Super friendly owner and great tasting food! If you haven't tried this hidden gem on Noriega, your stomach will thank you (and your wallet too)

It's never crowded and always makes me feel good!
author: Lauren N.

description: Ambiance in this restaurant is not the best, but everything else is! Usually no wait, good service, solid food and a nice big menu, and great prices. I'm really happy for this neighborhood restaurant.
author: Teresa M.

description:
Walking around and walk in here. Clean, friendly waiter but... Food is , ok. No where near the quality of Marnies and on the lower end of Thai food. 

I ordered Chicken Satay. No peanuts in sauce, tastes sweet and pre-made. Chicken tasted bad, like it was microwaved. No Thai tea with out cream and sugar. Pre made. Food looked nothing like the picture. 

Not good for San Francisco. This pace belongs in the Burbs. Disappointed.
author: Mario A.

description:
Extra star for good service. But everything else was a little disappointing.
Price is cheap but when you look at the portion, small portion.

Food:
Got the specials. Panang beef which was fine, pad thai was too sweet. Grilled meat was okay. We got some drinks which was just mediocre. 

Not sure why people raved for the food.
author: Claire J.

description:
A really good Thai food! 
The owner are really friendly and attentive. 

This place is actually better than expected, the Lanna fried rice are super delicious! 

Me and my friends enjoy dinner here will def come back again next time!
author: Priscilla F.

description:
$10.00 dinner specials an great service, what's not to like about that?

The food was good too, not overly great, but for the price it was well worth it.

Green curry tasted good, the satay was on point, and the complimentary soup was good. And the hot fried banana dessert that came with dinner for an extra $3 was more than worth it. It was an up charge of $3 for dessert, tea, and the satay which was worth it.

The owner was super friendly, and I would definitely return again.
author: Jack R.

description:
The first time we came here, my mom and I checked the hours from their pictures and decided to go. I noticed that some Yelpers stated that there were differences in the Yelp hours and the pictures of the restaurant's hours. Even when we went during the restaurant's hours, they were closed! 

The second time I came back here with my mom and all was well. The restaurant was opened. We specifically came back the second time to order the stuffed chicken. We placed our order and drank our tea (btw they charge 1.25$ for tea). The server (he's also the owner of the restaurant) reported back to us that they were out of stuffed chicken. To our dismay, we ended up ordering the Pad Thai dish and the garlic pork chop dish.

Finally, after learning our lesson multiple times, I called the restaurant specifically to ask if they had stuffed chicken. I was expecting a "No sorry we ran out" or even a "Yes we do," but I was left listening to a dial tone. Even when the hours were specifically stated that they'd be open, apparently they were closed.

Days later, I called to ask if the stuffed chicken was available and the owner said yes. I ordered takeout and went to pick it up. Let me just tell you, all those times of perseverance paid off...

because their stuffed chicken is so so so delicious. They stuff the chicken with vermicelli and cabbage (aka Heaven). The vegetables on the side are cooked with butter. The sauce they provide with the stuffed chicken is like a universal sauce they give as a side for other dishes.

Moral of the story: Call a restaurant before arriving, you never know if they decided to open or close. Make sure to ask if they have that one specific item you're looking for. Their Thai food differs from King of Thai or other Thai restaurants because they literally cook it there fresh for you; you can taste it! I hate how good their stuffed chicken is because now I'll keep wanting more, even when their hours of operation are fluctuating.
author: Erica K.

description:
Will be back for sure!!

I got the #55 Lana fried rice and it was tasty. It had so much stuff such as onion, tomato, pork shreds, chicken, shrimp, etc. It also comes with raisins but I opted out on the raisins. For only $8.95, I think it's super worth it since it has all different kinds of meat.

I also got the tom yum for about $3, which tasted delicious too. They even had a lot of specials and daily specials on the menu.

Thai food is so expensive nowadays so for the price and quality of their food, I love this place.

This place is nicely decorated, and since it's a smaller store, it was pretty quiet.

The service was great, and the owner (I assume) is super friendly. I wish I found out about this place sooner!
author: Julian Y.

description:
I've been here coming here for years. I swear the food has never changed. I can't say what is authentic but Paul and his wife makes it as authentic as I think it can be to me. Every other Thai restaurant Just doesn't cut it for me compared to lanna's.

- Thai ice tea, can't go wrong or maybe I just like the one here more 

-Tom kah Kai aka coconut soup is my favorite soup here. The lemony scent and slight sourness with the aromatic coconut flavor just makes me want some now talking about it. What can I say. This soup got some of my favorite flavors in there and they make it good.

- appetizers . I don't think I've gone wrong with any of the apps here. the appetizer sampler is great for 2 people to try a few things

- stuffed chicken wings is fried, soft, and it's just good. they actually use to stuff the filling between the bones but that was 10-15 years ago?

- lanna fried rice, the rice with everything in it and it's really good. Pineapples, tomatoes, dried pork shreds, raisins, chicken, shrimp. The seasoning is yum

- Kai yang, the bbq chicken isn't always available but it's a great deal for the quantity, flavor, and price

-fried banana fritter , I can't eat like I use to but this was really the best part for the end of the meal. Crispy crunch outside, soft inside. Love it with coconut ice cream
author: Myron L.

description:
This review is so long overdue! My family and I have been going to this restaurant for almost 20 years! I grew up in this neighborhood and would walk down the street and pick up lunch/dinner from here when I was in High School. Now that I am a "grown up," I still come here. I bring everyone here - my family, my friends, my clients, etc.! 

Pro's:
- It is a small family owned business (love this, because I have a small family business)! The husband runs around and takes care of his guests, while the wife (Hi Lanna!) does all of the cooking in the back. Both the husband and wife are extremely friendly and just the sweetest!
- The food quality. Yes, I have been to many great Thai restaurants in San Francisco but after actually going to Thailand, this place does not compare to the rest. It is AUTHENTIC! I feel as though I am right back in the right of Bangkok and eating the most delicious street food. My favorite's - shrimp appetizer, spring rolls, pad thai, red curry and my mom/ and fiance love the pork chops.
- The price... All I can say is WOW! I feel like they have never raised their prices! You can literally dine here with 5 people and not go over $100. Where else in San Francisco can you get that?! 
- Corkage fee is only $8 (I suggest you bring your own bottle of wine here)
- I'm not sure why people call this a hole in the wall. Sure, it's not fancy, but it's clean, warm and nicely decorated! The table in the middle is perfect for parties of 10 and more! 

Con's:
- I'm honestly trying to think of one and I can't. Maybe the fact that sometime's it can take a while to get the food, but keep in mind, there's only one person in the back cooking so just be patient! OR... TIP: order in advance. When we come here with a large party, I always call a few appetizers in so once we arrive, they're already on the table!

Love, love, love this place! Thanks for being a neighborhood staple!
author: Anastasia N.

description: Cute husband and wife running this restaurant. I cook a lot so I think they are using fresh paste in their curries. It may take a while to get your food. But it's great! Lunch special is wonderful and so cheap.
author: Madhu P.

description: Waited 30 minutes for our food and the food was just alright. Expected the spicy angel wings to burn my mouth but it barely had any spice at all. After we finished eating we had to wait another 20 minutes before we got the bill. It seemed like they didn't even want our money. Would not recommend.
author: Jimmy Y.

description: Very good food, highly recommend it if your in the area. A little cozy spot, not to pricy.
author: Juan C.

description: I had the pad see ew and the yellow curry. Both were delicious. I plan on going back here.
author: Lisa Y.

description: I live nearby, so it's a quick and easy place to get some good Thai food with a good price. I love their stuffed chicken wings. They have specials every weekday, so ask about those. I like to add a Thai iced tea to my meal.
author: Denise C.

description: This place is under rated. The friend rice is A1 and the guest experience was top notch too. Def recommend if you're looking for something authentic.
author: Ralph R.

description: My boyfriend and I came for dinner. Very reasonably priced food and wine for $4 a glass! Amazing. The staff were very gracious and helpful. A great place to find vegan and vegetarian food. We had the green curry, pineapple curry, and the coconut soup. All delicious!
author: Becky G.

description: I've been coming here almost 3 times a week. Really great pad Thai and garlic roast pork.
author: Steve K.

description:
The owner , a nice soft spoken man doing all the work, except cooking is super sweet. He has just one female cook out back. His nice demeanor and service alone is worth 5 stars. The food ain't bad either. 
5 stars !
author: S C.

description: Excellent food at an unbeatable price with fast and super friendly service! Definitely a new favorite
author: Elissa M.

description:
Can't believe people still eat here. There was only 6 other people eating here before we sat down. It took 10 minutes to get our drinks. 30 Minutes to get our first soup. Over 40 minutes to finally get our food. Serve only checked in on us once to apologize for the wait but there was no reason for a wait in the first place. 
Thai ice tea was watered down and just tasted like sugar water. Ordered the Pad Thai with prawns combo which tasted like soy sauce vermicelli noodle and only came with "one" tiny shirmp. Some weird tasting chicken in a very pasty clumpy sweet sauce that looks like curry sauce. Soup was luke warm and flavorless. The seafood noodle soup was just as bad. No flavor other than the onion pieces. Seafood was chewy and bland.
I would give it a negative rating if I could.
author: Henry T.

description:
CHEAP CHEAP lunch specials! If you know me, i like eating cheap bomb food. And this place has amazing lunch menus! Mostly was below $8 bucks and they have daily specials for $6.99! Perfect!!

My friends and I got the padthai with bbq chicken daily special and it comes with a soup! Soup was mehh super bland tasted like water but the entree was good! Good portion, good combination of chicken bbq, pad thai and rice!! I was satisfied and we even got a dessert! Now now... the fried banana and coconut ice cream was sooo good!! The best! Sooo so worth a try! Portion was kind of small though.

Service was good too. Overall i enjoyed the food here and will come back!
author: Debbie D.

description:
Despite the Yelp faux-pas of always getting the same thing at Thai restaurants, my go-to is vegetarian pad Thai:
- I'm too lazy to make decisions
- Vegetarian makes me feel healthy (plus it's real food, not something dismal like plain steamed vegetables)
- You can tell it's good Thai food when the pad Thai is tasty without being greasy to glossiness

Veggie pad Thai never really goes wrong, but here it was so good it was devoured in no time.  It had the homemade flavor striking a balance inclusive of the signature fish sauce, spicy chili, savory soy sauce, and sweet tamarind.  It left me comfortably satisfied without any repugnant greasiness.  At $7.45 for dinner, I definitely want to brag that I have found the quintessential hidden gem in this random mini restaurant row in Noreiga, except it was a friend's suggestion so unfortunately I can't take credit (citing my sources!)

The ambiance is cute, very homey Thai decor with tropical touches... they should share decorations with the tiki bar down the street.  Service is cute too, as in family run business cute--I'm not sure though, so don't go about in a frenzy slapping on a local business sticker on their window. 

As if inexpensive and tasty and cute were not enough to make this a new go-to Thai place, they have lunch specials as well as daily specials.  The online menu is helpful, as it contains prices, descriptions, and pictures (photos are not dSLR food porn pro level, but makes me crave Thai food nonetheless).  Good thing this is some distance from the UCSF campus so I can walk off some of those pad Thai calories.
author: Edna C.

description:
Microwave beeping in the kitchen. Beep beep beep red flags 
One of the worst Thai food I have ever tasted.
Lacked flavor , authenticity , skill.

Local mom and pop shop. Nice decor and good service. Guy takes orders lady cooks in the back. Since 1988 but place was empty when I arrived and how you manage to stay open for so long with the type of product you provide 

some house soup cabbage msg water. 
Nothing special and the soup water tastes funny4/10 

Fish cake 6 small ass pieces cut in half with sweet dipping sauce 7/10. Had some ok flavor but the portion is way to skimp.

Pad thai worst I have ever had in the city. Skimp portion meat and tofu looked so skimp. 3/10
Hollywood Thai pad Thai where are you in SF? 

I had high hopes but when you tried good Thai food in LA this place can't compare/compete. Save yourself the trouble and money and stay away from the food here. 
Overall the food sucks! The service is good but who goes for service unless you want to :)
author: Dan M.

description: The meal i had  was amazing.  It was my first time coming here.  I had a craving for Thai food and this place was on the top of my list.  The restaurant is nice and cozy.  They have a lotto station at the front entrance.  They also have 2 televisions that show lotto numbers and the other shows menu items and gives a description.  It works out great.  The setup of this place is nice.  Lots of wood and decorations on the wall.  I think i was the first customer in today which was really cool for me.  I did want to get a Thai iced tea but i completely forgot. I looked at the menu and noticed that the Thai iced tea here looked real good.  Good vibes here. Definitely coming back again.  The owners are this nice older couple.  Good times here.  They also do take orders. Next time i will call in my order but either way it was a good experience.
author: Robert F.

description: Mom and Pop operation with good prices. Local place that we have been going to for years.
author: Montgomery G.

description:
Nope. Ordered panang beef curry takeout, which I was enjoying until I felt a LONG HAIR. IN MY MOUTH. 

This is why hairnets are required in kitchens, people. Maybe now you'll be more careful with your sanitary practices.
author: Michael D.

description: Loved the pad Thai! The prices are amazing. The waiter, maybe the owner?, is so nice and he does a great job checking in on you. Seems like a neighborhood gem. I don't live in the neighborhood, but I'll definitely be back. Very casual place.
author: Jacquelyn H.

description:
pretty average but cheap.

Nice small family owned establishment

no delivery so that was a disappointment
author: Agnes K.

description:
Craving some good ol' Thai food, I discovered a hole-in-the-wall place nearby by the same name as my old stomping grounds in Marin, Lanna Thai. I obviously had to give it a try and compare it to what I remember.

I ordered their Friday combo with Pad Thai and mussamun curry, which at under $10, is an amazing deal. My girlfriend got their egg noodles with Panang curry. Both dishes had great flavor, though perhaps a tad on the sweet side. There's tons of dishes to choose from and they all look good. I really enjoyed the variety of the combo and it was exactly what I wanted on the chilly evening. I look forward to going back many times!

Service was very friendly and, evening with the one big party in the restaurant, we still got good service. The prices are just right and the food is delicious. Along with King of Thai Noodles, it's my new go-to Thai places in the city.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Can't go wrong with a $7 lunch special, The Curry is to died for. Service is excellent!
author: Average Blue Collar M.

description: Try this place out!! I was pleasantly surprised at the tastiness of the food here for under $7! Daily lunch specials M-F cost only $6.95, are filling, and the whole menu ranges around the same price too. Today my friends and I all ordered the daily special and we all loved it: pad thai with rice and bbq chicken. For dessert, we shared the fried banana with coconut ice cream, and savored it to the last bite. The environment is pretty ornate and there's lots of seating. Service was great and our waiter was funny. I will be back!
author: Corinna T.

description: This is the second time I've tried to eat here but the hours are all over the place. The hours on Yelp are completely different to the ones posted on the restaurant's door. Please update!
author: Linda O.

description: We came after Hardly Strictly Bluegrass and waited quite a while for food but it was DELICIOUS. We ordered vegetarian pad thai and panang curry with steamed rice on the side. Rosé is $2.75 a (small) glass too which is definitely a plus! Since we went at a super busy time on a super busy night we asked another two diners to share a table with us and ended up meeting some lovely new friends!
author: Rachel P.

description:
Lanna is not a place I would have found on my own. San Francisco is not one city but a cluster of culinary micro-climates like the heavily Asian fog bank that makes up this stretch of Noriega in the Outer Sunset. My massage therapist (yes, I have one...sometimes...don't judge me!) recommended it to me a while ago, and he looks like a very healthy eater with a penchant for spicy Southeast Asian by way of his Malaysian-bred wife. So I convinced Jamie W. to make the trek with me to try it on an evening where we felt the need to try something healthy. We didn't accomplish "healthy", but we managed to have some surprisingly good eats for the drive. 

We started with a hearty $6.95 bowl of Tohm Kah, the coconut milk soup with chicken, mushroom, baby corns, green onion, lemongrass and lemon juice (see photo). Perfect starter on a cold night. The $6.25 order of Chicken Satay came with a couple of skewers marinated in curry paste and accompanied by the all-critical peanut sauce with a nice consistency (see photo). Entrees were solid. We went even more predictable with the $7.25 Pad Kee Mao, which offered the thick chow fun noodles mixed with chicken, broccoli and bok choy (see photo). 

Jamie went back to his Kentucky roots when he was drawn to the $8.50 Barbecue Chicken, which came with four big pieces slathered with a sweet curry sauce that wasn't too overwhelming (see photo). It didn't seem like a particularly Thai dish but who cares. We should have been sated, but we decided to try the desserts since we made room. The $2.75 Flan was delicious enough, but the standout was the $3.75 Fried Banana with Coconut Ice Cream. Fried with a crunchy crust and a nice contrast to the bracing coconut flavor of the ice cream (see photos). Definitely worth a trip out to the far reaches of the Sunset for us downtown types. 

FOOD - 4 stars...excellent Thai dishes, well priced 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...compact place, could do without the lotto boards 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...good though attention wavers when big parties come in 
TOTAL - 4 stars...barbecue chicken and fried bananas almost give this Thai place a country twang
author: Ed U.

description: Their food is great.. their customer service is horrible, and sadly good food can't make up for bad service.
author: Robert L.

description: Cute little neighborhood restaurant. Nice Thai food options! :) I would recommend the ginger chicken!!
author: Stephanie K.

description: My local Thai spot in the sunset. Great pricing, happy service, and most importantly great food.
author: Curtiss G.

description:
~3.5 Stars~

While the food was tasty and delicious, their portions were a bit lacking. I didn't know if it was because we walked in 30 minutes before closing, but it seems from other reviews that we were not the only ones who felt this way. (I felt bad right before closing--but we spent all day moving into a place a couple blocks away so we were hungry and it was the only open closeby option)

WE ORDERED:
- $30 dinner for 2 set which included:
Tom Yum Soup (2 cups -- we ordered an extra cup since there were 3 of us)
Fish Cake Appetizer
Yellow Curry with Chicken
Garlic Pork
Steamed rice
- Sauteed veggies with tofu (don't remember the name, it wasn't very memorable)

THE GOOD: 
+ Everything was tasty
+ The Soup wasn't overly sour and I really enjoyed this
+ The Curry flavor was very good
+ I like the mom&pop service atmosphere
+ Very friendly and fast to refill water

THE BAD:
- Small portions and therefore not worth the price
- Slow service getting food out (even though we were the ONLY people in the place)
- Thai curry is made with coconut milk which gives it a thinner consistency than Chinese/Japanese Curry. I found it very odd that they served this on a plate instead of in a bowl, so it just spread out over the entire plate which made the amount of chicken seem very sparse and made it more difficult to spoon it onto the rice (very tasty though!).
author: Jenna H.

description: I have been enjoying this place for some 20 years.  Family owned and operated.   Try great fresh steamed veggies with your meal.  J.P.
author: J P.

description: Per the great reviews, my expectations were high. A bit disappointed with the small portions for a take out order. I will give this place another chance at first impressions. This time I'll eat there in hopes to share a great review like everyone else.
author: Alex R.

description:
Good food with erratic business hours.  Some days they open on time and some days they open late and some days they don't even open.  A shame, since I love their Lanna Fried Rice.  I wanted to order take out at least once each month, now I only call them about once each year.

I'm baffled that they've managed to stay in business all this time.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Pad Thai with Chicken
Pad Thai with Vegetables
Pad Thai with Prawns
Pad Thai taste so good here.

Curry this, 
Curry that,
Curry Yellow, 
Curry Green, 
Curry spicy light me on fire,
Why didn't I order a Thai tea prior?

I would walk by this place every morning on the way to work, it was always closed because I would walk by at 6am. I finally had a day off and decided to try it after reading the many Yelp reviews, hearing the mixed feelings from friends, and looking at the menu as I would wait for the 28 outbound bus. 

I'm glad I tried the food here because I think it may be my new lunch spot throughout the year on days off!

SERVICE:

Impeccable. Friendly. The waiter made sure that the cook would only cook the food with half the amount of oil normally used for making the Pad Thai. I like my rice noodles to be less crispy sometimes. 

ATMOSPHERE: 

If I ever go on a date, I would bring a date here OR come here with a small group of friends and family. 

UNTIL NEXT TIME!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Came in for the first time half an hour ago & this place is by far one of my top Thai places in my neighborhood. The food is authentic and flavorful! I had the Wednesday special, which was Panang Chicken Curry and Stuffed Chicken Wings. It was delicious! This might just be my Wednesday spot, lol. 
I will def be back!
author: Camille Y.

description:
Made a date with Mona C. last week for today. I chose the restaurant because I wanted something not too far from home or school, because I have school right after, night classes really suck. After reading and finding this on yelp (maybe half a year ago) I really really wanted to try this place, that's why it's been bookmarked FOREVER on yelp & Mozilla. I came here once before, but I think I came too early on a weekday for lunch, so ended up going elsewhere. I FINALLY had the chance to go today.

I was reluctant to go because she always takes pictures of EVERYTHING, and it's so embarrassing...I guess it informs the yelp community by taking pictures of everything. I sometimes do that too, I wonder if it's embarrassing for others. She takes pics of the place and the FOOD. If I'm starving, she has to take a perfect picture (and the first shot is never good enough) of the food before anyone can eat, so I always try to mess it up by eating the food before she remembers to take a picture, I'm so evil. She even took a picture of my water today. It wasn't so embarrassing today, since there weren't many people.

I looked at their website prior to coming and it showed that everyday had a special, except Sunday (I guess they rest on the Sabbath Day). Today for lunch, it wasn't crowded, only another group of people were there. 

Today is Monday, so I had Monday's daily special which is Pad Thai & Panang Curry with Chicken. Out of all the specials, I would say Monday's seemed the most appetizing to me, you get PAD THAI & PANANG CURRY WITH CHICKEN, a good deal to me since I probably would have gotten that anyways. Both items were good. Curry came with rice and pad thai was yummy too. Lots of variety for only $6.29.

I would come back during other days to see what all the other specials are like.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Very good food. Good prices.  Friendly and attentive service. 

The employees here actually treat you like a human, something I can't say for the rest on this street besides maybe Noriega Tarraki House.

I had the Chicken Pad Thai and it was great.
author: Justin S.

description: We've been eating here for over 25 years, since we moved to the Sunset way back when, and we've continued visiting since we moved across town. Fantastic food, friendly service, the owner's known our daughter since she was a baby and is always welcoming. The spicy Lanna Chicken is my favorite, but it's all good. You can also buy jars of their peanut sauce to take home, which I strongly recommend. Just a terrific neighborhood place, and some of the best Thai food in SF.
author: Mason J.

description:
Lanna thai has been around for ages. (saw it here decades ago. may have dined here once.)  the sunfaded wallpaper is a tell. this doesn't detach from the homespun ambience of lanna thai. an  annoyance is the  flatscreen constantly flashing pics and numbers of items on the menu.

many items on lunch special, hard to choose one.

sampling: lunch special:  panang curry with chicken (6.25)
-generic green onion and veggie soup: ok
-curry pronounced, good flavored, chicken tender not tuff,  eggplant and pea kind of mushy, zuchinni and bamboo shoots ok.
-jasmine rice generic, ok though, lunch 3 stars. regular menu probably 4
(you get what you pay for for)

leftovers:
-service excellent,  refilled water 3 times, no msg problem, just thirst.
-service leisurely, heartell it's mom & pop.
-def return when i finish noreiga st.
author: Victor G.

description: awesome place in the sunset.  Stuffed wings were delicious and they made the fried banana ice cream in the shape of a smiley :)  Definitly repeat.
author: josh d.

description:
Disappointing overall -- I expected more from a place with a 4-star average. Got take-out from here today for lunch and felt that the portions were pretty small given the prices. The deep-fried tofu appetizer came with ~8 pieces ($5.45!), which was cold; however, one star goes to the peanut sauce that came with it on the side.

One more star for the Tom Kah Kai soup -- coconut milk-based soup with chicken, mushrooms, and baby corn -- which was very flavorful and definitely the best part of the meal. The Pad Thai came with 3 prawns and the rest was a clump of very dry noodles without much flavor: probably some of the worst I've had.

I'd like to give a third star for the Rama Thai, as the combination of delicious peanut sauce, chicken, and spinach was excellent... the only problem was that the entire portion could be consumed in a few bites, which was disappointing (again) for the $7 it costs for that one "special."

Glad that there are plenty of other Thai restaurants around, as my search for a good one must continue.
author: Justine M.

description:
special noodle dish today was the chicken curry noodle soup.
WOW!
wider egg noodles in a curry broth that was incredibly awesome.
think about the best yellow chicken curry you've ever had and turn the curry sauce into a curry soup.
here it is.
order it and walk away completely satisfied.
author: Jeff W.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood eats, Lanna always leaves me feeling satiated without a big hit to the wallet. My go to's are the pad Thai & cashew chicken, yum! My fiancé is a big fan of the ga-prow. But really, the only thing we weren't sold on was the stuffed chicken wing. This family business really needs to stick around - please eat at Lanna!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Mmm...*really* good chicken pad se ew! (how is this pronounced by the way???) It tasted amazing, ate the whole plate, however at one point I ate a little chunk of brown sugar that must have not disintegrated...

My friend and I told the owner we were in a hurry and he was very nice and our food came out quickly. The restaurant is clean and I recommend the coffee with pearls! (bubble tea I believe it is called?) 

Overall good place for lunch!
author: Julia F.

description: This is an example of how unreliable yelp can be. Four stars really? Slow service sub par ingredients. Should have gone to China north or green bamboo.
author: M C.

description: I am still waiting for my soup since the past 35 min. The waiter wouldn't come to take my order or serve me water but would pull the chair for the girls and bring them ice teas in 2 min. Wtf is this!
author: Aakash T.

description:
[M]ona: 4 Stars
[W]ayne: 4.5 Stars
Average: 4.25 Stars

+ Excellent Service
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Inexpensive
+ Extensive Menu
+ Daily Specials
+ Quick Service

[W] So tonight me and Mona had a craving for rather Thai or some other Asian spot and I'm really glad we came here. Mona has a knack of dragging me to places where she HAD eaten before but she just procrastinates so much that she forgets how everything was so she takes me to review it first haha. 

[M] That's why I have you baby! XD

The food here was actually pretty good. We had the Yellow Curry with a side of white rice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6y26VcGgSuiJrcXk6YKXyw?select=B8x0c8VnTHY4LLQGLS860A, Veggie Pad Thai http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6y26VcGgSuiJrcXk6YKXyw?select=G61x-p3lL8IjO96vC2DHmQ, and a Banana Fritter with Green Tea Ice Cream http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6y26VcGgSuiJrcXk6YKXyw?select=gaT9Am3XHOHNf7AabUcQSw. The owner was really nice as well and his service was quick too.
 
[W] We were just 1 of the 2 couples in the restaurant so it wasn't that busy. Parking was extremely easy today; basically we got a parking spot right in front of the restaurant. There was really nothing bad to say at all with this restaurant dispute the Caucasian couple behind us was speaking Jesus and talking VERY loudly. 

The curry didn't taste pasty or sandy (if you ever had bad curry) and the pad thai was very saucy and smooth. It was funny because when the other couple left, the owner was cleaning the table and he looked at us and he was like "wow you guys are so clean!" My bad was to their table so I looked back and mannnnnn, they were pigs lol. Crap on the table, crap on the floor.....aiya lol. Anyways, yea this place is awesome and the owner was awesome also. JUST AWESOME!! lol (Relating to I Love You Man).
author: Mona C.

description:
I really want to know how this place has  more than 2 stars. 

I went here for take out. I called my order in and when I went to pick it up I should have turned away. The place smells funny, like musty old people's house and mothballs. I Was thinking how does the food not over power this smell, but I was hungry. 

I  got home and tried one of the spring rolls, and to my dismay it was so bland it was like eating cardboard, the dipping sauce didn't help much either.. So I moved to the rice. Just steamed rice, and I was a little pissed off that my rice box was hardly filled to the top. I then opened my chicken item, it was in a medium sized box and once again I opened the box and it was only half full. 

 the food has absolutely no flavor to it. I didn't think this was at all possible with Thai food, but lanna has really nailed that one. And the food tasted old everything had a strange foul smelling gravy on it, the item that I ordered shouldn't have had gravy on it. I hate gravy.

I ate the food, and now my stomach is in bad kind of way.

Considering there are so many Thai places in the city, why the hell is this one still open. But I guess it's all good. They sell lotto tickets in there too. WTF? I will never again go to this place! Mark my words and read my lips.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Since we were in the area, my family and I decided to try this spot for dinner. The staff was very attentive, which is probably the only thing that was memorable. I'm saying this because every dish we had was just OKAY...not bad, but just okay.  Our entrees didn't really look too presentable and there was just way more sauce on the dish than there was meat or vegetables - we didn't have enough to share amongst 6 ppl. 

I made sure to order the peanut sauce (which we had with tofu as an appetizer) since it was one of the highlights of Lanna on Yelp. They even sell their sauce for $5 a jar!  When I finally got to taste it, I was pretty disappointed because it tasted like they just melted spoonfuls of Skippy.

Other dishes we ordered: The Pad Thai and the Beef w/ spinach were probably the best out of everything we tried; Panang Beef (okay); Yellow Curry (okay); And Chicken Satay (super dry)
author: jesiree b.

description:
We are new to San Francisco and wanted to try out a Thai restaurant near by so we decided on Lanna Thai. I am glad we did! We had Tom Yum soup and Tofu green curry. Both were excellent!

I also really liked the small and cozy feel of the restaurant itself. It's perfect to relax and enjoy tasty food, cold beer, and good conversation.
author: Victoria M.

description:
I came here because the pictures for this restaurant looked really good. I got the Pad Thai and Stuffed wings daily special. The Pad Thai tasted a bit different than it does at other places which i found interesting, not in a bad way but different than what i'd expect. I have to say I didn't care much for the stuffed chicken wing. I felt the stuffing didn't compliment the chicken very well. 

I don't think I'd come back since there are so many other Thai options in the area.
author: Eric M.

description:
Whenever I come here, I feel like I'm going over to a family member's house and it's my aunt and uncle who are cooking me food. This place is so homey and immediately makes you feel comfortable. 

The first thing you notice about this place is how immaculately clean it is! Paul, the owner, walks around in his spare time windexing the glass tabletops and making sure each table is spotless. 

For me, the service has always been very good. I've been here so much that my family and I know the owners and they are always very friendly and attentive. 

The food is sooo good! When you look at this place from the street, you'd probably think this place was a little dingy and disappointing. But seriously, I would say Lanna is one of the best kept Thai secrets in San Francisco. Try their stuffed chicken wings--seriously the best I have ever had. Juicy and stuffed with ground pork and noodles and cabbage and fried to a perfect golden brown. Another favorite of mine is the garlic pork chop. It is super flavorful and super garlicky. Yum. And the cabbage soup that comes at the beginning of your meal is perfect. Simple, and perfect. 

Did I mention this place is ridiculously cheap? Lunch specials are $6.49 and always come with 2 items (i.e. pad thai and curry, curry and bbq chicken, stuffed chicken wings and pad thai, etc). And any item off the lunch special menu is typically $8 or less. I could pig out here and never feel guilty about the damage (or lack thereof) to my wallet. 

As an added bonus (?) you have the opportunity to partake in the California Lottery here! Granted, I didn't win the $640 million jackpot when I  played here, but I got some tasty grub out of it.
author: Michelle Q.

description: YUM! We went to SF to see the mosaic steps on 16th ave and then were looking for a good spot to have lunch. My boyfriend wanted Thai, and we found this place on Yelp. He ordered the Saturday special (stuffed chicken wing and Thai curry chicken), which had so much flavor! I ordered the prawn curry, which was a little on the spicy side, but I like spicy. I loved my dish...bell pepper, pineapple, curry and prawns. I should have taken a picture but I ate it too fast! But they have pictures of almost all their food on their menu, which is helpful. Oh, I almost forgot! We also had an appetizer of fried calamari which was also excellent....sweet and spicy and definitely satisfying! Will for sure go back here again, the combination of great service, delicious food and fair pricing is a winning combination.
author: Sara W.

description: Nice waitstaff, good food, but you have to know it's going to take a long time to get it.
author: Kris F.

description:
This is my favorite Thai place in the city for several reasons.  The owner is very friendly, and I have gotten to know him a bit, since I started have been coming here.  The place is small and rarely is it crowded.  It's very clean and the atmosphere is tasteful.  I would take a date here.

I have no complaints with the food.  It's all delicious, from the noodles, to the curries, to the appetizers, to the desert.  Don't come here if you are looking for the most authentic Thai food.  They will make your dish less spicy and more "Americanized" than true authentic Thai food.  Still, I take my friends here all the time, and we are never disappointed.

The prices are reasonable.  I always leave a large tip, because this place does not appear to get as much business as it deserves.  The couple who owns the place are very friendly.
author: Jackson W.

description: This place was awesome. Very nice homey feeling. The pad thai and egg rolls were both bomb and the fried ice cream for desert left me so full, but in the best possible way. :)
author: Olympia Z.

description: Very good food here.  Favorites are any curry, pad thai, Thai ice tea, stuffed chicken wings and tom yum soup.  They also have daily specials that are good for single diners.  They've been around for almost 25 years....go check them out.
author: Dkac C.

description:
So the 5 of us walked into the little restaurant and there were seats right away.

It is a really nice and cozy place. We tried a variety of curry and dishes. UNfortunately, they didn't have any fish cakes and stuffed chicken wings we asked for, both of which we really wanted to try.
So we had the panang curry, yellow curry, fried calamari, pumpkin curry and one of the daily special with chicken, pad thai, and white rice.

The yellow curry and panang curry were all right but the portions were so meager. The pumpkin curry was pretty good with a lot of shrimp but it could have used a little but more flavor.
The fried calamari was pretty good too, just some simple salt and pepper.
The pad thai was actually my favorite, and the chicken was my 2nd.

We also ordered fried banana, which was good except for the fact that they used regular butter in the batter. They should have used unsalted butter because it was really satly!

All in all, not a bad experience but you have to serve it up a little better to convince my parents to come back. At least I will come back to try the stuffed chicken wings.
author: Wilson T.

description:
I was wanting pad see ew but  wanted to keep costs low.  Saw the 4 star reviews & price point so decided to give it a try.  Saw the lotto machine inside the front door of the restaurant and thought...ok, a little strange - maybe it's like a corner store with great food & Yelpers say 4 stars & cheap so it's going to be either totally awesome or totally not.  I walked inside & it was a regular restaurant but with a lotto setup.

Very friendly and sweet staff.  Started with tea & was happily surprised that it was jasmine.  I'm sorry to say that the food was sub-par in quality & flavor.  

The chicken in my noodles was wing meat with pieces of cartilage I couldn't chew through mixed in. There wasn't much chicken in it and maybe 4 small pieces of broccoli. 

The gentleman let me know that the pad Thai sauce was pre-bought but the pad see ew sauce was made in-house.  I didn't try the pad Thai, but thought someone deciding to come for the pad Thai might want to know that. 

I tried the fried spring rolls.  They were bland.

The tom ka soup was yellow and was likely the worst I've ever tried. 

Sorry Yelpers but either this place went way downhill or it's another page from the twighlight zone.
author: N A.

description: Great neighborhood joint for cheap, fast Thai. The older gentleman who probably owned the place was very warm and friendly. The two of us ordered 4-5 dishes and pretty much polished everything off. My favorite was the pork chop, fried and cut up into slices.
author: Jenny J.

description: The best Thai Food is SF is here at Lanna. Have been going there for over 20 years and have no complaints. Excellent service and an awesome peanut sauce with the Satay Chicken.
author: John E.

description: Just got an order to go for the first time, after eating a plateful I realized there was a large cranefly or similar bug in it.  Super grossed out.  The food was really bland not much flavor except the peanut sauce was good.  Sad that I now have to throw away everything because I don't know which container the bug came from :(  Was really hoping for new place within walking distance I know bugs are an accident but eww.
author: Nirea S.

description: Are you even in business?  Found the business hours on Yelp saying that they open at 11:30 a.m. for lunch (Monday).  I got there at 11:45 a.m., door was locked, dark inside.  There is a sign on the door that says opens at 12 noon for lunch.  So I waited and waited and waited and it was 12:10 p.m. and still no signs of anyone coming to open up.  Not good!  Went across the street to another restaurant.
author: M C.

description:
Meh.
It has potential. We came here craving Thai food and it had pretty good reviews. I guess if you like plain Thai food this is the place to go. But I love Thai because of its amazing flavored. I got the yellow curry. It wasn't gross, it was just alright. It tastes like something my mom could make. My boyfriend got the spicy crispy fish, he thought it was okay.  I thought it was too salty and tasted really fishy like the fish had been sitting in the fridge for a while. 
We got the sampler appetizer. The egg rolls were tiny but pretty good. The chicken satay tastes like yellow curry and peanut sauce and the fried stuffed chicken was really weird. My boyfriend wouldn't even eat it after the first bite. The soup and the beginning was weird too. It reminded me of swimming pool water haha

The waiter was really nice but the service took a life time. We were there for over an hour. Waiting 20 minutes just for them to take our credit card. Eventually my boyfriend just went to the window and paid. 

Like I said its not terrible but I probably wouldn't eat there again. If I do for some reason I'd try the pad Thai next time. 

Super cheap though so that's great. I guess.
author: Melinda M.

description:
I'm glad yelp can be my trusty sidekick whenever I'm out and about and need to pick up something to eat. It hasn't failed me yet!

I found this place when i need to pick up some lunch for my boyfriend and I. I found out about this place because of the cheap lunch specials. I was also attracted by the fact that they offer rice plates with pad thai on the side? AND chicken? AND soup? wow and for only under $7, it's a wonder why they don't have more ratings. 

I ordered the daily special ($6.50 rice, pad thai, bbq chicken, soup) and the Saturday special ($6.95 rice, panang curry, stuffed chicken wing, soup). Doesn't it already sound mouth watering? All my favorite dishes combined into one plate, unique indeed! 

The owner was also very sweet. He could tell I was in a rush and tried his best to get me my food. He was welcoming and hospitable and made an effort to check on all his customers. Loved the service!

I got my food and took it to my boyfriend. We definitely enjoyed the food, though it's not exactly the best I've had, I love the fact they offer the unique lunch plates and for that, plus the service, I'll definitely come back for more visits!
author: Connie C.

description: My first time at this restaurant was a success! An older gentleman, possibly the owner, seated my friend and I for our late dinner. He was very sweet and was eager to provide a pleasant experience. My friend is a vegan, I am a vegetarian, and neither of us had any issues finding something yummy on the menu. The curry is delicious!
author: Timorei A.

description:
A great place to get Thai food in a casual setting.  I ordered the Friday Special, which includes Pad Thai and some curry.  Both of them tasted high quality.  

Prices are great, usually below $20 per person.   The restaurant is clean and the waitstaff friendly.  They will fill your water without even asking.  +++
author: Ben S.

description: This place is a fairly small, family-owned restaurant. Our server was very friendly and I thought their food was pretty good.  I really liked that you could make your entree a combo by paying only $5.99 more! The combo includes soup, an appetizer, and dessert; such a good deal! i ordered the pad see ew and my boyfriend ordered a seafood curry dish (forgot what it's called). We also had this coconut-based soup, spring rolls, chicken satay, and fried banana with coconut ice cream. So yum. I will be back when I'm craving Thai again!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Very tasty and fresh. We came here for late lunch/early dinner while our car was getting serviced a few blocks down at  Sunset Service. The Tom Kha and Tom Yum soups were both fantastic, we each got a cup and traded back and forth. The soups deserve 5 stars alone.

We then got the veggie tofu version of the ground rice salad like Larb which was also really good. They use lettuce with it here; I have had it other places with cabbage which maybe is a little more of an acquired taste, but still this was very very good. 

My friend and I then shared orders of the Rama Tofu and Green Curry Veggies. The Rama Tofu is a peanut-curry dish that comes on a bed of steamed spinach - almost had a flavor of a Japanese Gomae. We both felt that there was maybe too much sweetness/sugar though. Would like to see it with the sweetness toned way down, because the dish has great potential - I'd even see if I could order it less sweet, and maybe do some hot sauce with it. The flavor and consistency of the fried tofu in it was excellent, as was the spinach, which is why I might see if the sweet level could be modified.

The green curry we ordered with just veggies and it was full of them all cooked to perfection. I ordered it hot, which was maybe one degree too much for my friend, but I didn't even have to ask for water so I had no issues with it. It was great.

Complete dinner including a Thai Iced Tea for my friend and my diet drink was under $35 including the tip.

I will go back, for sure.
author: Emily C.

description: This place looked simple at first but when you walk in, you're greeted by a friendly waiter. The tom yum was amazing and their curry too. On top of the amazing food service was great. Can't wait to come back another time!
author: Henderson L.

description:
A small little place with decent Thai food.  It wasn't too packed for Sat. dinner.  My friend was able to get a table quickly

- Rama Tofu was very good!
- Panang Curry with chicken was decent

Service was very friendly and good.
author: Coco L.

description:
*slow motion* OHHHH YEAHHHH.

The owner is really nice, in my experience he has been consistently pleasant.  He works with his wife, who cooks and is equally sweet.  The food is good, and not too expensive.  I mean, kinda but there's a lunch menu, and even daily specials where you get a bunch of stuff for under $10.  I like the panang curry (it's a red curry) with prawns.  The pad thai is good too and I like that you can heat it up afterwards and it's not like eating rubber bands.  I'm just gonna warn you though, at times I've felt the pad see ew was a little bland.  Just sayin.

Oh yeah, and if you are ordering pick-up and you call in with your order, it will be helpful for you to know that they don't really answer the phone like a business, so there's a potential for confusion.  They'll be like "hello?" so you think you just called someone's house or something.  One time I really did call someone's house and started ordering thai food... but that time was my fault. :/
author: Paz R.

description: I love Lanna Thai. The owner remembers my name because I always go there for Lanna fried rice. Their other food is good too but the fried rice is my favorite. :)
author: Ryan R.

description:
Came here for lunch since i was craving a thai salad. I actually wanted to order a papaya/mango thai salad BUT they didn't have it!! I always order it when i go to all the other thai places but this place didn't have it which was so weird! But the owner was nice enough to offer something else with the same kind of sauce. He told me to order the seafood salad which came with squid, shrimp, scallops, lettuce, and green beans with a swt&sour sauce. It was VERY tasty! but I did not like the greeen beans so i pushed it all to the side. 
The place was pretty empty when i walked but and the food took a pretty long time to make which is weird since its just a salad. There was only 2 people working (wife and husband i think) since there wasnt too many people there eating. 
overall, its a cool place to eat lunch if you're in the neighborhood but i would not go out of my way to eat here since theres nothing that stands out too much.
author: Linda N.

description:
I really wish they moved Lanna to my hometown in LA because this place is quaint and cozy, while still having amazing food. The little old man who served my friend and I was so kind and gave amazing recommendations. 

Because of him, my friend got the pad see ew and friend ice cream while I got the heavenly "mansa munsa curry"... I know I probably slaughtered that one but it is the first one listed under curry! I don't really eat spicy food but I love curry and he told me that MANSA MUNSA was the curry for me! It was so simple yet amazing! Just a little sweet with a tad bit of salty and carrots, potatoes, onions, and chicken speckled throughout the curry sauce. However, the chicken aspect wasn't very good (too fatty for me) so that is why Lanna doesn't get the full 5 stars!! It had only the slightest bit of spice and you get an adequate amount of rice to go along with your curry so you aren't left with a heap of left over rice or loads of excess curry sauce! 

You also get free cabbage soup, which is very light and delicious!!! I loved the broth!!! So I definitely give this place ... 4 thumbs up :D SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESSES!!!
author: Erin T.

description:
STILL one of my favorite Thai joints in the city. It's a lovely couple owned and operated business and, after a trip down to Anaheim, one of the reasons I love living in the city -- for delicious, unique food made by pleasant people.

Came here with a foreign friend that was allergic to dairy as well as a vegetarian. Didn't realize just how many vegetarian options Lanna has to offer. Even though she couldn't drink the house soup (chicken broth!), we got pad see ew and pad thai vegetarian dishes, as well as the coconut soup and a vegetarian curry. All were quite delicious and I got the stuffed chicken wings to satisfy my carnivorous side :).

You really can't go wrong with Lanna's specialty, stuffed chicken wings. I just need to emphasize just HOW good they are, plus you can have them almost every day of the week paired with a curry or noodle through the daily lunch specials.

As like most Thai joints, lunches are relatively cheap and dinners are considerably pricier. Lanna is like this, but like GOOD Thai joints, completely worth it. The menu has something for everyone from classic dishes to more unique ones that you WON'T be able to find just anywhere.

Service is usually very good unless there's a surge of customers. The food is consistently delicious. And best of all, the restaurant is VERY clean (look at those scorecards!!). Bonus: I love drinking the water out of the wine glasses like I'm a huge deal. Score!

Parking: Noriega isn't as horrible as Irving but not as good as Taraval. When I go for lunch, I try to parking across 19th avenue near the more residential side (no meters). Beware of street cleaning!
author: Kris Q.

description: We have been coming to Lanna Thai over the years and the food is always consistently good. love the Banana fritter desert as well as the stuffed chicken wings. The dining area is small and cozy and service attentive. Enjoy!
author: Gilski R.

description:
A gem in the rough...

My bf and I have been here several times for dinner individually and with friends and family.  We've never been disappointed with any of the dishes and especially love their peanut sauce.  

The restaurant is small and cozy reminding those of us who live in the Richmond/Sunset districts of our own 2 level homes.  The owners are a husband and wife team with the wife in the kitchen cooking and the husband out and about mingling with the customers.  

Overall, this is a great restaurant where you can sit, relax, and enjoy an authentic Thai meal at an affordable price.
author: A W.

description:
Many main entree combinations to choose from, only a couple desserts, few apps to choose from.

Nice food presentation. 

Veggie Egg roll amp was plenty, the egg roll was ok, the sauce was very salty.
BBQ Chicken was nothing special. Although it wasn't rubbery,  it was dry but soft.
Their soup was delish, though the baby corn tasted straight from the can.
The curry could be better, a bit bland. 
Pad Thai was dry, bit rubbery thin noodles- I wouldn't order it again.
Thai tea was too sweet, a hint of tea flavoring.

Service: positive friendly older gentleman.

Ambiance- Casual setting- outdated interior, has a smell of old 80s bldg.

Overall, it's worth a try. Expect to wait a while when busy. They tend to bring out single orders before multiples, even if you arrived 40 mins before.
author: J K.

description:
Wow, this place is good. The decor looks like the inside of a 1970's single family home. It is cute and quaint. The food is excellent. The vegetarian Pad See Yoo and the green curry are a definite must. Filled with fresh veggies. The green curry is spice and they can't make it mild for some reason. The coconut soup is super good for one of those cold nights. Medium fills 2 tummies. 

Great Thai place for the Sunset District. Parking can be tough but is do-able with patience.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
So after moving into my new apartment, I had to see if there were any worthy, nearby restaurants I can walk to. Unfortunately for me, I'm pretty much in between Taraval and Irving and closer to Noriega than ever before. And sure, Noriega has the reputation of being the lesser of the three main restaurant streets in the Sunset/Parkside area (fourth if you count the last two or so streets of Judah, but I'm not,) but now, it's part of my neighborhood and I had to give it a chance.

So with friends, we started looking for a restaurant on Noriega that WASN'T Wasabi. My friend and I had all ready tried Green Bamboo and we wanted to see what else was there. Fortunately we were in the mood for Thai and Lanna was right there, looking us straight in the face. So we decided to try it out to see what it was all about.

Long story short, I really like the place. For some reason, I think it's better than King of Thai. There's just something about it that I prefer. The food is pretty good. I think I might have had better Thai food elsewhere, but it's rare. The service is great; the man who usually greets everyone is really nice and polite, at least to us. The prices are affordable and you can get a good amount of food without having to dig too deep into your wallet.

The only problem I have with the place is that the place is a little bit too small. Granted, I think that's what gives it its character because it's a small mom and pop place and it's pretty comfortable in there. That is unless there's a huge, loud group taking up a third or half of the restaurant. Other than that, it's not too bad. Taking that step outside of the place can be a bitch if you're not looking, too, but I've never fallen flat on my face so it's not bad.

Personally, I think it's one of the better restaurants on Noriega. Granted, I don't have too much experience with Noriega, but I've been to enough restaurants both on the 19th side and closer to Sunset to know it's pretty good. I've been here multiple times after my first visit, and I'll definitely come here again when I feel like Thai.
author: Chris S.

description:
Steps away from my house, order takeout there often~simple, pretty cheap, but good thai food.

Love their Lanna Fried Rice, Tom Yum soup, and stuffed chicken wings!!
author: Chloé N.

description:
lanna fried rice is pretty good.

the panang curry noodle look good but was very disappointing.

this is a miss for me. sorry
author: Erica L.

description:
3.5 Stars

I live a few blocks away from Lanna Thai for 26 years and today was my first time stepping foot into the restaurant. Overall first impression was good. Lanna Thai is a small, quaint restaurant with many historical Thai decorations and for some reason they also have Keno on their TV. 

The service was great even though there was only 1 waiter but i assume the restaurant was run by owner and his wife (who was in the kitchen). I ordered number 32 (Chicken Ga Prow: Sauteed fresh chili, onion, green onion, bamboo shoot, bell pepper and basil.) which was pretty good and had a nice spicy kick. Overall, i thought my dining experience was delightful. 

Great alternative if you are NOT in the mood for Japanese and Chinese food if you are in the neighborhood. Plus Lanna Thai had the "People love us on Yelp" sticker and you cant go wrong with that :)
author: Carol Y.

description: I got take out it. Egg rolls, yellow curry, fried rice and pad ke mao. Everything was delicious! Very fresh and not greasy. Best thai food I've had in the sunset. I highly recommend this place
author: Stacey K.

description: Great at home vibe with friendly staff and comfortable food.  Family owned and you can play lotto!
author: Marisa W.

description:
I'm borrowing from Yelp, but "meh, I've had better."  

I went on Saturday afternoon and there were some tables filled, but not enough to be super busy by any stretch.  It took close to 50 minutes to get our very simple orders.  The reason that was such a problem is that the meters on Noriega are capped at 1 hour, which necessitated a mid-lunch meter refill.  It looked like there was only one guy serving, so I'm not docking them too much for it, but still that was a long time for a Saturday afternoon when the restaurant wasn't full.

I didn't like the TV with rotating pictures of the dishes.  Frankly, it would have been better to be some random show than just the pictures of dishes.

Biggest problem though is that my veggie pad thai was just boring.  Very little tofu, maybe 5 carrot chunks, maybe 5 pieces of cooked cabbage, and maybe 5 slivers of celery.  If it hadn't been for the raw cabbage on the side, I'm not sure I would have noticed any texture other than the noodles.

The one plus is that the price was good.
author: Scott B.

description:
Daily Lunch Special: Pad Thai and BBQ Chicken (also served with soup and rice for around $7).

I've been here several times.  Service is always wonderful and their food is always great. I'll definitely be back.
author: B B.

description:
My husband and I come here very often. The owners are from Chiang Mai and have been in business for many years. The wife cooks and her husband serves. Very homey and feels like you are visiting family. I really like the Pad Thai because i don't like the very sweet or oily renditions elsewhere. The Basil Fish is really yummy too. My husband likes to get the daily special (usually Pad Thai, rice and different types of curry depending in the day, sometimes include their stuffed chicken wings). Oh! FRIED ICE CREAM!!! need i say more. 

It is a little quiet but I personally like it without the rush and wait!
author: Gillian Y.

description: Hmmm... I'm surprised it's taken me this long to write a review. Maybe I'm selfishly trying to keep this place to myself. What can I add that hasn't already been said. The family here is so great! Whenever I come in they ask how I've been. As a vegetarian, I love the options at this place. They also do take-out and the prices are reasonable. They've also taken us in at 9:30 (they close at 10 on some days) for dinner, when they could have easily said no. The servers here are attentive and so nice. The food always tastes great!
author: Crys L.

description: Small portions and tad bit pricey. What I remember the most was my friend packed half her meal for lunch tomorrow and received an even tinier portion to go with missing shrimps! That's shady.
author: Ellie J.

description:
I am giving Lanna Thai 5 star because they are amazingggg!
Always very friendly and the food gets even better. 

I eat poultry so i always order the Tom Kha Kai Soup with chicken. The balance of all the spices combined and the way it smells, makes it #1 in my book from anywhere in the city. As well as the Pad See Ew Noodles, the perfect amount of soy sauce and spices, it can be a bit on the sweet side, but i prefer it that way. 
The great thing about Lanna Thai is that they have a wide menu of dishes to choose from as well as Lunch and Dinner Specials and Plates! The price is very affordable as well.

I am never let down, and i keep coming back for more. Send people their way, you will have a great experience and enjoy the food ever more!
author: Mia G.

description: Super nice owner. It can get a little slow service wise because there is only one person front of house and one person in the kitchen. The food is definitely better than some other places I've been to. I love the pad kee mao and the fried banana with ice cream! Definitely a place I'll be going to more often.
author: Katherine L.

description: Great spicy angel wings and curry! Down home kind of place!!
author: Monique A.

description:
The only Thai restaurant I have tried but it is still gonna be one of my favorites!

The decor of the restaurant is so pretty and is very clean and pristine. They have a wide variety of food on their menu and hands down I just love their Pad Thai and Stuffed Chicken wings the best. If you get their specials of the day I feel those are the better deals and are only about $9. I also love their Thai Iced Teas with tapioca. They know how to make them right!

All in all, if you're ever in the mood for thai food I recommend this place and it's a place you can easily find off 19th ave.
author: Kristine W.

description: Food was not bad but not good either. Ordered their special fried rice and waited for almost 30 mins... too slow!
author: Vicky Z.

description: Prices are definitely reasonably during lunch, but my yellow curry dish was uninspiring today. They put peas in it, which I have never seen at a Thai restaurant. My friend's pad thai looked better.
author: Natalie S.

description: I tried to go into this place with my service dog, and the staff denied me entrance even after I stated my need for the dog. They told me that if I wasn't blind, I couldn't have him with me. Asians are so unjust when it comes to service animals. The owner closed the restaurant an hour earlier after I told him I would call and report him for his actions. I didn't try the food, but with service and staff like that, its sure that Im never coming back to this shit hole.
author: sasha l.

description:
My best friends and I (ie: the dog and boyfriend) took a stroll up and down Noriega after picking Mochi up from daycare. We came across Lanna Thai Restaurant and I had to get some Pad See Ew. After the distaster that was King of Thai (on Sloat) I was praying for a good serving of noodles.

I was supposed to share...But I didn't. I did, however, leave a to-go box full of broccoli for Joe to eat (: Can you tell he's lucky?

The noodles were considerably good after having stopped several places before heading home to enjoy my food. It was a little more peppery than I'm used to, which was weird because I didn't see any pepper on the noodles, but I was definitely pleased. I'll most definitely be back!

The restaurant itself is too cute. A very homey feel, and the help seems very kind. The lady that took my order at the register complimented Mochi who was  outside patiently waiting for me (: 

The rating is more like a 3.5 for to-go. I'll definitely update again once I have time to sit down and eat. Maybe we'll go again on Monday before we pick up el perro from daycare.

mmmm pad see ew...*drool*
author: La De Da C.

description:
Lanna was one of my favorite lunchtime locales when I used to work at the Providence townhomes right down the street. However, if you are looking for a quick bite, you should head somewhere else because this place was designed with atmosphere in mind. Remove the photographs of former Kings of Thailand, and you would think you just stepped into some French or Italian cafe. This is the type of place where you are supposed to sit for awhile, and soak it all in.

The ironic thing is that Lanna is merely a mom and pop shop (not a knock on it by any means), with only two employees - the wife cooking in the back, and the husband serving. However, I think most restaurants in the City should take some notes from this dynamic duo, as they are some of the most efficient I have ever seen!

Now, I am extremely inexperienced with Thai cuisine (this is the only Thai restaurant I've ever been to), but from what I gather, my taste buds seemed to approve. I can't vouch for the authenticity, but in the whole scheme of things, does it really matter? All that I care about is that it tastes good, and that it does.

However, with the good, comes the bad, although they are rather minor, nitpicky things:

*It's too dark. I'm the type who likes to see what I'm eating. Also, being the klutz that I am, stabbing my nose with the fork is no fun, indeed.

*The California Lottery Keno screen ruins the whole mood. I can see how the owner would like it though, since it brings in additional income, but I rarely see anyone playing.

*It's a bit pricy. $7.50 for a lunch combo is on the upper end of the spectrum, considering all the cheap Chinese eats for $5 or less right next door.

Overall, if you are in the upper Noriega region, Lanna is a nice place for a relaxing lunch. The clientele here during the lunch hour is mostly older Caucasian ladies, with the occasional Asian (surprisingly so, in this 60+% Chinese neighborhood), but I have never felt uncomfortable.

P.S. Do Thai people not use chopsticks? It feels weird eating Asian food with a fork.
author: Eric W.

description:
Just ordered the fried calamari and pad thai. The calamari was a tad too sweet but what made the meal awful was the pad thai. It was NOT edible. Had a horrible taste that I cannot even begin to describe. 

Yuck
author: Sandy Y.

description: Great neighborhood eat!  I love this wife and husband duo.  They're always in the mood for conversation if you want, and the food is not bad.  Nothing fancy but definitely still worth your while.  My favorite thing on the menu? Fried ice cream! Probably the best I've ever had.  Honey over a crispy doughy shell over ice cream.... can't ask for more *drool*
author: S. D.

description:
A tough choice the other night:  Pizza delivery accompanied by the 1,427th showing of  "The History of Bricks" on the History Channel, or get off our butts and follow our appetites towards something we might actually enjoy.  We chose the latter, and headed west, drawn by the siren song of  Lanna Thai peanut sauce, seemingly oblivious to the surrounding culinary wreckage of Noriega street.   

The Rhama Thai with tofu was a sure thing, with tofu and spinach drenched in the revered Lanna peanut sauce (buy some pre-packed to take home).  Vegetarian egg rolls were also terrific, crispy and flavorful.  Can't say the same for the prawn curry, which tasted something like pineapple soup with shrimp, not quite a crime against nature, but a head-scratcher nonetheless.

An endearing and enduring feature of Lanna, aside from the lovely family that owns the place, is the ongoing Lotto Hot Spot game and ceiling-mounted video monitor for your playing enjoyment.  Thai food enthusiasts who also happen to be gambling addicts will surely enjoy the never-ending 5-minute lotto cycles, where players can play to win anywhere from $1-$20 a round.  Sadly, no one was enjoying this novelty during our dinner.

We hadn't paid particularly close attention to the menu prices,  and were somewhat shocked to get out the place for $30.  I can't remember the last time I had any dinner that cheap, let alone a good one.  Such a nice experience, a great dinner, a night out, and secure in the knowledge that "History of Bricks" will undoubtedly be airing for the 1,428th time sometime soon.
author: Hugh B.

description:
Lanna Thai sits nestled along with other family owned businesses on Noriega.  Inside is cozy; the mirror makes the dining room appear larger than it actually is.  Even though I'm already set on what to order before stepping foot in the door, their menu with full color pictures was tempting enough to flip through.  Service is provided by the friendly proprietor.  As others have mentioned, their peanut sauce is one of the better ones around.

Having both sides of the Sunset covered, I'm sure many people flock to Marnee when they've got a hankering for Thai.  Next time, trek down a few more blocks...Lanna deserves a lil lovin', too.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Two words: PEANUT SAUCE!!!

I've been to a number of Thai restaurants over the years, and none have had a peanut sauce that has met my standards that Lanna has set.  Try it with the chicken skewers, or as a main dish with the "Pra ram long sam," beef over spinach with peanut sauce.

That said, the other dishes are also very good, in particular the prawn lemon soup (which BTW is fantastic if you've got a sore throat).

A pleasant restaurant, generally not very packed, and the staff is always very kind.

Huzzah for Lanna's!
author: Corey C.

description:
Are you serious!? How is this place even averaging four stars? I must have come in on an off day or something because this was one of the worst Thai joints I've ever dined at.

A few friends and I came here for lunch a few days ago. I was pretty excited to try the place out because I used to eat at a Lanna Thai out in Oklahoma when I lived there for a little bit. Thai food in the Midwest? Yeah I know...I was blown away too because it was the best Thai I've ever had. I was hoping that by some small chance this Noriega one was part of a huge chain. Let me tell you...shit didn't even come close.

Here's what we ordered:

Pad Thai- Strangely discolored, and painfully bland
Chicken Satay Skewers- Tasted like they were microwaved
Pad See Ew- Discolored, bland, with weeks old broccoli
Spicy Angel Chicken Wings- Only thing that could pass as edible
Lanna Fried Rice- Supposedly their specialty, but once again was dreadfully bland, overcooked, and looked like cafeteria food.

I would have given this place a one star, but the fact they had video Keno to keep me entertained bumped it up to two. If you're looking for bargain Thai in the Sunset, do King of Thai--it's quick and decent. If you're in the mood for something a little more high end, drop on by Marnee Thai. Whatever you do, though, I'd advise you to stay away from this place.
author: jeff c.

description: Best Thai I've had in a long time! I went with my dad and sister. We started with the Khung Ka Borg, then moved on to  the bbq chicken, yellow curry, Pad Thai Wonton, and Lanna Fried Rice. WOW!!! All excellent. It's the kind of food you wake up craving in the middle of the night. I would definitely go again.
author: Tricia S.

description:
Wow! One of my favorite tom kahs in the city, and the curry is generous and rich. Lanna is a mom & pop restaurant where every meal is made fresh and well worth it.  The dining atmosphere in the restaurant proper is never crowded with a cozy, homey vibe, and hey - they sell lottery tickets, to boot!

If only they were open on Sundays...
author: Ash A.

description:
Having just moved to the Sunset, I'm on the local restaurant tour. I'm thrilled that this place is in my neighborhood.

We went on a Monday night and the place was deserted. The gentleman who served us was very kind and helpful. My boyfriend and I had one of the "dinner for two" meals, and it was perfect. Actually, there were enough leftovers for me to get two lunches out of it, too. The soup was my favorite part, but the rest of the meal was good too. 

Next time, we will be sure to order the food "spicy." There wasn't really any spiciness in the curry that we had, but it was still good.
author: Michelle M.

description: This is my first time in this restruant Order 3 items, the best one is called the Pad Kee Mao. Spicy and very good.
author: Jill Y.

description:
My friend Derrick took us to this place cuz he swore that their spicy angel wings were the greatest food since the invention of steak.. Well.. Close..haha..

Those wings were sweet, savory, and then had this heat on the way down.. I would say.. Asian Buffalo Wings..

The thai was normal and adequate, but damn.. Those wings.. hhmmm..
author: Carlo M.

description: The best kept secret dessert in the Sunset neighborhood is Lanna Thai's fried ice cream.  $3 and enough to share with someone.
author: George K.

description: This is a simple family run neighborhood restaurant. It's not fancy but I really like that it's quaint with friendly and fast service. I've always got good food from here whether I eat in or take out. It might not be 5 star quality food but it's far from bland- it's tasty!! Be humble and enjoy :)
author: Jackie N.

description:
Five stars for service

Five stars for price

Five stars for variety

Three stars for flavor

Rarely are we in the Sunset, but we had an oil change to take care of and a Thai craving to satisfy. This was the closest Thai place to the oil change and four stars on Yelp didn't hurt. The place was nearly empty when we arrived, so we were promptly seated. The older guy was super nice and cheery and made sure we were taken care of throughout the meal. The egg rolls were great, but the yellow curry and the noodle soup (tried looking for the name, couldn't find it) were pretty bland. I definitely had better Thai, but the service and price made up for lack of flavor.
author: B B.

description:
My BF and I went to this restaurant last night. We were looking for a new Thai restaurant to try in the Sunset and decided to give it a go. Service was pretty good. Our server (owner/husband) was very nice and hospitable. However, at times, it was a little slow waiting for him to take our orders and to give us the check. But overall, his service was the highlight of our dining adventure. The two stars are for the service...not the food.
